thread.title: The Walking Dead T-shirt removed from Primark over complaint that it was racist
thread.title_full: The Walking Dead T-shirt removed from Primark over complaint that it was racist

author: Katie Fitzpatrick
title: The Walking Dead T-shirt removed from Primark over complaint that it was racist
text:
Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Walking Dead T-shirt has been removed from Primark shelves following a complaint that it was racist. 
The white T-shirt, in homage to the fearsome character Negan in the horror drama The Walking Dead, had the slogan “eeny meeny miny moe”, referring to a terrifying scene which saw him chose a victim to bludgeon to death with his baseball bat. 
But the T-shirts have now been withdrawn from shops after a shopper complained about the text, saying it was “fantastically offensive” and “graphic.” 
Minister Ian Lucraft decided to make a complaint about the men’s T-shirt while browsing in the store’s branch in The Moor, Sheffield. 
The phrase was used by the twisted character Negan, played by Jeffrey Dean Morgan, in one of the most shocking scenes in the hit FOX TV show about Sheriff Deputy Rick Grimes leading a group of survivors in a world overrun by zombies. 
Eeny meeny miny moe is a children’s counting rhyme, used to select a person in games such as tag, and the most common modern version continues the rhyme with the words “catch a tiger by the toe.” 
But Mr Lucraft pointed out that an earlier version of the rhyme used the N-word and sent a letter to Primark’s Chief Executive asking for the T-shirt to come off sale. 
In The Walking Dead, the word “tiger” is used, instead of the N-word. Read More 
A spokesman for Primark said the t-shirt had now been withdrawn and added: “The T-shirt in question is licensed merchandise for the US television series, The Walking Dead, and the quote and image are taken directly from the show. Primark on Market Street, Manchester 
“Any offence caused by its design was wholly unintentional and Primark sincerely apologises for this. 
“Primark is currently removing the product from sale.” Read More
